author: Svetlana Belkin
message: You think using Zim Wiki with the version control could help you?

replies.author: Aurélien Gâteau
replies.message: My goal with this policy is to reduce the time spent on project admin tasks while still producing useful code, without imposing regressions to users. I am not sure how Zim Wiki would help to achieve this.

author: anonymous
message:
Why you not put those project to github or bitbucket?
And if you have your own server, you can use such tool as gitlab.
In my work we use Gitlab as repo management tool for lots of project - work and private. This is ultimate git repo management tool IMO (with wiki for each project, simple code review, grouping, acl, public access and much more).

replies.author: Aurélien Gâteau
replies.message: This is actually the plan, just have a look at the number of git repositories I have on GitHub :). GitHub is awesome, but I felt it would be good to write down how I plan to manage those GitHub repositories.
